paper_abstract: Let Delta >= 2 be a fixed integer. We show that the random graph G(n,p) with p >> (log n / n)(1 / Delta) is robust with respect to the containment of almost spanning bipartite graphs H with maximum degree Delta and sublinear bandwidth in the following sense: asymptotically almost surely, if an adversary deletes arbitrary edges from G(n,p) in such a way that each vertex loses less than half of its neighbours, then the resulting graph still contains a copy of all such H.
paper_title: Almost Spanning Subgraphs of Random Graphs After Adversarial Edge Removal
